body:
`randomData` 里使用的是 new Date()
所得到的值是不确定的值。所以并不确定形成的数据在哪个时间点上。

因为我的tree node很多，所以有时候会叠在一起，用户在观看的时候观感不好，所以就开放了收缩的功能，但是收缩时，只有node本身的节点收缩了，富文本没有收缩，导致观感很差。我截个效果图
![tree收缩问题截图](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64525374/80692511-414e4500-8b04-11ea-91d4-77b08d93320d.png)
如上图，node放大了，但是富文本没有放大，导致我富文本外的地方也能进行按钮点击，收缩节点

这个不限制，用户自由设置，但是我给个用户之前用tree，我模拟的一个截图


![tree-node折叠](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64525374/80693419-8f177d00-8b05-11ea-94ea-0f713fbedbb0.png)

![tree-node折叠2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64525374/80694527-36e17a80-8b07-11ea-9c70-d3853425b359.png)

图好像看不到，一层有20个node

其实最终我想解决的是node 堆叠问题，因为用户有时候是需要截图，但是现在截图就会堆叠，看不清有的node
目前我有两种思路，
1、收缩的方式，但是收缩现在的问题就是node收缩，富文本不收缩
2、没有地方设置node的间距

还一种就是调整画布大小，但是现在找不到好的方式去计算如果不堆叠，宽度怎么计算
是否有具体的配置项 `option` 来看看是配置能解决的还是需要修改程序？不同的图表的情况有些不同。

Similar to #11975.
Fixed and will be released in 4.8.0 soon.

A typo to:
https://www.echartsjs.com/examples/en/editor.html?c=doc-example/text-block-fregment

If adding an option `showCount: true` and make built-in implement, it become a "common feature" and need to define how it look link and how to configure its style and where to lay out it. It's not a easy work I am afraid.
I think it's probably better for user to make the `count of data` displayed in like `text component` or `series label` or `custom series`, which is more flexible.

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. 🎉
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! 🍵
**Only circles have all arrows visible.**
Thank you im able to access the public gallery now. Just curious to know what had happened
Will set [layoutAnimation](https://www.echartsjs.com/en/option.html#series-graph.force.layoutAnimation) as `false` help?

It's by design. 
After theme updated, it needs to dispose the current chart instance and re-init a new chart.
Probably a callback is required in each iteration of force layout.

@zevero According to document, `interval` on axis only provided for category.
For @anan-lee 's case I can reproduce in [https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html?c=xU-XwwOWbA](https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html?c=xU-XwwOWbA) , is trying to investigate the problem.

@rushtokunal An idiot mistake, the domain expired at that time.

> @yycyeung Have you tried the latest ECharts? Version 4.7?

Yesss. still got "prepareCustoms[coordSys.type] is not a function"

> A `coordinateSystem` in your case is required. If you want to use echarts in leaflet, you may need an echarts plugin for leaflet. Within the example, it can draw polygons by using the [custom series](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-custom) since it depends on the plugin [Extension for Baidu Map](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/tree/master/extension/bmap) which is provided officially.
> There may be no need to use bmap, you can search in Github with the keyword `leaflet-echarts` to pick one suitable for you.
> BTW, I think the version you are using is too old, it's better to upgrade it to 4.x. :)
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26999792/80602231-705faa80-8a61-11ea-808f-192ba908461e.png)

yess. I use echarts-leaflet, the third one in the pic I updated the echarts to 4.X.X but still got "prepareCustoms[coordSys.type] is not a function"

@susiwen8 Sure. In latest commit I added a test case using same option as original issue [using](https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html?c=xOcNMBdkE&v=1)
and below are before&after comparision
Before:
![Before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3318968/80932559-98009b00-8df2-11ea-8fca-f8798423ef00.PNG)

After:
![After](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3318968/80932557-9636d780-8df2-11ea-99d0-51b98e2bff7a.PNG)
@yycyeung OK! I have found this error is caused by the `echarts-leaflet` plugin since this plugin does not support custom series. I will give you some fixing suggestions later. :)

> @yycyeung OK! I have found this error is caused by the `echarts-leaflet` plugin since this plugin does not support custom series. I will give you some fixing suggestions later. :)

great! thanks a lot

BTW, we can also draw polygons with `leaflet` api and it's not necessary to use echarts to draw.
```js
var leaflet = myChart.getModel().getComponent('leaflet').getLeaflet();
var latlngs = [
    [39.53, 116.7],
    [36.03, 103.73],
    [27.87, 112.91],
    [28.01, 120.65],
    [39.95, 119.57]
];
L.polygon(latlngs, { color: 'red' }).addTo(leaflet);
```

Also, that's our expected result.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26999792/80934321-40fec400-8dfa-11ea-8b48-f6a2f723b190.png)
